chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (l1 l2 : seq R) (e : expr), (forall k : nat, nth 0 l1 k = nth 0 l2 k) -> interp l1 e = interp l2 e

Premises:
Notation seq := list
*** [ R : Set ]
interp = fix interp (l : seq R) (e : expr) {struct e} : R := match e with | Var n => nth R0 l n | AppExt k f le => apply k f (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | AppExtD k f n le => Derive_Rn k f n (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | App e1 e2 => interp (interp l e2 :: l) e1 | Subst e1 e2 => interp (set_nth R0 l 0 (interp l e2)) e1 | Cst c => c | Binary o e1 e2 => match o with | Eplus => Rplus | Emult => Rmult end (interp l e1) (interp l e2) | Unary o e0 => match o with | Eopp => Ropp |
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Inductive expr : Type := Var : nat -> expr | AppExt : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> expr | AppExtD : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> nat -> seq expr -> expr | App : expr -> expr -> expr | Subst : expr -> expr -> expr | Cst : R -> expr | Binary : bop -> expr -> expr -> expr | Unary : uop -> expr -> expr | Int : expr -> expr -> expr -> expr For Var: Argument scope is [nat_scope] For AppExt: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ list_scope] For AppExtD: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ nat_scope list_scope] For Cst: Argument scope is [R_scope]
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ list_scope nat_scope]
is_const_correct : forall (e : expr) (n : nat), is_const e n = true -> forall (l : seq R) (x1 x2 : R), interp (set_nth 0 l n x1) e = interp (set_nth 0 l n x2) e
OmegaLemmas.fast_OMEGA13 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2)%Z -> P (v * Z.pos x + l1 + (v * Z.neg x + l2))%Z
OmegaLemmas.fast_OMEGA14 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2)%Z -> P (v * Z.neg x + l1 + (v * Z.pos x + l2))%Z
expr_ind' : forall P : expr -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (Var n)) -> (forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), foldr (fun (e : expr) (acc : Prop) => P e /\ acc) True le -> P (AppExt k f le)) -> (forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (n : nat) (le : seq expr), foldr (fun (e : expr) (acc : Prop) => P e /\ acc) True le -> P (AppExtD k f n le)) -> (forall e1 e2 : expr, P e1 -> P e2 -> P (App e1 e2)) -> (forall e1 e2 : expr, P e1 -> P e2 -> P (Subst e1 e2)) -> (forall r : R, P (Cst r)) ->...-> forall e : expr, P e
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
interp_domain = fix interp_domain (l : seq R) (d : domain) {struct d} : Prop := match d with | Never => False | Always => True | Partial p e => p (interp l e) | Derivable n k f le => ex_derive_Rn k f n (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | Derivable2 m n k f le => let le' := [seq interp l i | i <- le] in locally_2d (fun u v : R => ex_derive_Rn k f m (fun i : nat => if ssrnat.eqn i m then u else if ssrnat.eqn i n then v else nth 0 le' i)) (nth 0 le' m) (nth 0 le' n) /\ continuity_2d_pt (fun u v : R => Derive_Rn k f m (fun i : nat => if ssrnat.eqn i m then u else if...
SF_seq.nth_compat : forall (s : seq R) (n : nat), pos_Rl (SF_seq.seq2Rlist s) n = nth 0 s n
apply_ext : forall (T : Type) (k : nat) (f : Rn k T) (g1 g2 : nat -> R), (forall n : nat, (n < k)%nat -> g1 n = g2 n) -> apply k f g1 = apply k f g2
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
eq_from_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), size s1 = size s2 -> (forall i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) (size s1) -> nth x0 s1 i = nth x0 s2 i) -> s1 = s2
AppExt : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> expr
AppExtD : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> nat -> seq expr -> expr
SF_seq.SF_fun_incr : forall (s : SF_seq.SF_seq) (y0 : ?T) (x : R) (Hs : SF_seq.sorted Rle (SF_seq.SF_lx s)) (Hx : head 0 (SF_seq.SF_lx s) <= x <= last 0 (SF_seq.SF_lx s)), SF_seq.SF_fun s y0 x = match SF_seq.sorted_dec (SF_seq.SF_lx s) 0 x Hs Hx with | inleft H => nth y0 (SF_seq.SF_ly s) (proj1_sig H) | inright _ => nth y0 (SF_seq.SF_ly s) (SF_seq.SF_size s - 1) end where ?T : [ |- Type]
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
Inductive expr : Type := Var : nat -> expr | AppExt : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> expr | AppExtD : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> nat -> seq expr -> expr | App : expr -> expr -> expr | Subst : expr -> expr -> expr | Cst : R -> expr | Binary : bop -> expr -> expr -> expr | Unary : uop -> expr -> expr | Int : expr -> expr -> expr -> expr For Var: Argument scope is [nat_scope] For AppExt: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ list_scope] For AppExtD: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ nat_scope list_scope] For Cst: Argument scope is [R_scope]
nth_default : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat), ssrnat.leq (size s) n -> nth x0 s n = x0
ssrnat.subn0 = fun __top_assumption_ : nat => (fun (_evar_0_ : (fun n : nat => ssrnat.subn n 0 = n) 0%nat) (_evar_0_0 : forall n : nat, (fun n0 : nat => ssrnat.subn n0 0 = n0) (S n)) => match __top_assumption_ as n return ((fun n0 : nat => ssrnat.subn n0 0 = n0) n) with | 0%nat => _evar_0_ | S x => _evar_0_0 x end) eq_refl (fun n : nat => eq_refl) : ssrfun.right_id 0%nat ssrnat.subn
all_iffLR : all_iff ?P0 ?Ps -> forall m n : nat, nth ?P0 (?P0 :: ?Ps)%SEQ m -> nth ?P0 (?P0 :: ?Ps)%SEQ n where ?P0 : [ |- Prop] ?Ps : [ |- seq Prop]
ssrnat.leq0n : forall n : nat, ssrnat.leq 0 n
nth_iota : forall p m n i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth p (iota m n) i = ssrnat.addn m i
uniqPn : forall (x0 : eqtype.Equality.sort ?T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort ?T)), reflect (exists i j : nat, [/\ ssrnat.leq (S i) j, ssrnat.leq (S j) (size s) & nth x0 s i = nth x0 s j]) (~~ uniq s) where ?T : [ |- eqtype.Equality.type]
nth_nil : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat), nth x0 [::] n = x0
last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : seq T), last x s = nth x0 (x :: s)%SEQ (size s)
drop_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> drop n s = nth x0 s n :: drop (S n) s
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
nth_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (x : T) (n : nat), nth x0 (rcons s x) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) then nth x0 s n else if eqtype.eq_op n (size s) then x else x0)
SF_seq.sorted_dec : forall (s : seq R) (x0 x : R), SF_seq.sorted Rle s -> head x0 s <= x <= last x0 s -> {i : nat | nth x0 s i <= x < nth x0 s (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size s)%nat} + {nth x0 s (size s - 2) <= x <= nth x0 s (size s - 1)}
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => n | S k => match m with | 0%nat => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Inductive domain : Type := Never : domain | Always : domain | Partial : (R -> Prop) -> expr -> domain | Derivable : nat -> forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> domain | Derivable2 : nat -> nat ->...-> domain For Partial: Argument scopes are [function_scope _] For Derivable: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope _ list_scope] For Derivable2: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ list_scope] For Continuous: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _] For Continuous2: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope _] For ParamIntegrable: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ _ _] For LocallyParamIntegrable: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ _] For And: Argument scope is [list_scope] For Locally: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _] For Locally2: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope _] For ForallWide: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ _ _]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
